monogr.title: Queene Elizabeths looking-glasse of grace and glory : Wherein may be seen the fortune of the faithfull: that is to say, the wrastling, victory, and reward, or the combat, conquest and crowne of Gods children. All cleerely represented according to Scripture, & illustrated by diuers notable examples of Gods seruants both men and vvomen: and likewise enterlaced with many memorable alligories & morallties: both pleasant and profitable to be read. By I.M. Master of Arts

div.head: TO THE GREATEST HONOVR OF THE MEMORIE OF THE MOST ILLVSTRIOVS LADY OF SAMOTHEA, MARJE.
div.p: IN her lifetime Queene-heire of Scotland, Queene-dowager of France, and by naturall descent Princesse apparent of England, France, and Ireland;

div.head: A BRANCHE
div.p:
Sprung from the Imperiall and Royall stocke of CHARLES the great, once the
most Augustious Emperour of Romaines & Germaines, and King of France most Christian.

div.head: GREAT-GRAND-CHILDE
div.p: Of the most prudent and puissant Prince HENRY the seuenth, King of England, France, and Ireland, by his eldest Daughter borne in the blessed Bed of the happy Vnion of the two Roses, the most illustrious Queene MARGARET wife to the most vertuous & praise-worthy Prince IAMES the fourth King of Scots.

div.head: DAVGHTER AND ONELY HEIRE
div.p: Of the most noble, worthy & mighty Britanish Prince IAMES the fift King of Scotland, and of the most excellent and prudent Princesse his wife. Queene MARIE de Lorrayne, Dutchesse of Longouille, and daughter of the right magnificent Prince, CLAVDE Duke of Guise.

div.head: WIFE
div.p: In first mariage, to the most Christian King of France, FRANCIS the second; and in second mariage by Gods especiall prouidence, disappointing all the policies and practises of the Deuill, and euill men tending to the contrary, wife to the right generous and comely Prince her highnes nearest & dearest coosin, as being descended likewise from the loynes of HENRY the seuenth by his eldest Daughter MARGARET Queene of Scotland, by her Daughter in second mariage, the right illustrious Princesse MARGARET DOVGLAS Countesse of Angus, & Lennox, mother to the said Prince HENRY Lord Darley, Earle of Rosse, Duke of Albanie, Knight of the most renowned order of S. MICHAEL, and King of Scotland.

div.head: MOTHER
div.p:
By the foresaid most generous Prince, her Maiesties right entierly beloued husband, of the most Augustious Prince, our most gratious Soueraigne IAMES the CONCORDER, supreme Lord of Samothea, and the first
Christian Monarch and Vniter of this Ile;

div.head: GRAND-MOTHER
div.p: Of thee three graces of great Britaine; the most hopefull flower of Princes, HENRY the MAGNANIMOVS Prince of Cambria and of Cumbri, the most sweete tender Prince, CHARLES Duke of Yorke and Albanie, and the most gracefull Princesse Madame ELIZABETH Infanta of Albion;

div.head: THE FLOWER
div.p: Once of the whole women of her age, endued with an admirable fortitude, and magnificent bountie of minde, adorned with an incomparable pulchritude and beauty of Body; decored with the most heroicall and princely properties, and honored most, of all the Ladies of the earth, with the many often profered mariages of the greatest Kings, and noblest Princes of Christendome.

div.head: TO THE EVERLIVING MEMORIE
div.p:
(I say) of a matchlesse MARIE, once on
earth full of Grace, and now in heauen full of Glorie: and euen the peace-making mother of Albions greatest grace and vnited Glorie.

closer.signed: The Sonnes sonne of her highnes faithfull seruant, WILLIAM MAXWELL Sonne to the Lairde of kirkonnell, and in his life-time Man at Armes to the most Christian King, doth in most humble manner deuote & dedicate the LOOKING-GLASSE OF GRACE & GLORIE. IAMES MAXWELL.
